wackpackr.core

Class LZWCompressor

  • java.lang.Object
    • wackpackr.core.LZWCompressor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Compressor

    public class LZWCompressor
extends Object
implements Compressor
    Compression and decompression with a simplistic implementation of the LZW algorithm.

    Unlike in the other compressor classes, here it made no sense to decouple the encoding and decoding operations to helper methods. Hence the fairly bloated main methods.

    Author:
    Juho Juurinen

    • Method Detail

      • compress

        public byte[] compress(byte[] bytes)
                throws IOException
        Compresses given file using dynamic (variable bit size) LZW encoding.

        Writes a 32-bit identifier, indicating the used compression technique, to the beginning of the compressed binary, followed by the actual data in encoded form. Ends with a pseudo- EoF marker (zero index), and a few 0s to ensure that the EoF bit sequence is not partially cut off.

        Specified by:
        compress in interface Compressor
        Parameters:
        bytes - file to compress as byte array
        Returns:
        compressed file as byte array
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • decompress

        public byte[] decompress(byte[] bytes)
                  throws IOException
        Decompresses given file using dynamic (variable bit size) LZW decoding.

        Apart from checking the 32-bit tag in the header, there are practically no other measures to verify the file. Passing in a valid file is method caller's responsibility.

        Keeps on reading the input stream until a pseudo-EoF marker (zero dictionary index) is encountered. Throws EOFException if no such marker is seen before reaching the end of the input stream.

        Specified by:
        decompress in interface Compressor
        Parameters:
        bytes - file to decompress as byte array
        Returns:
        decompressed file as byte array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if file does not have the correct identifier in its header
        EOFException - if no pseudo-EoF marker is present in the input stream
        IOException - if there's an error writing to or reading from the I/O streams

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Compressor
